8a858d65-96a4-5d78-a48b-c741d099fdb1.title: Bisbee
8a858d65-96a4-5d78-a48b-c741d099fdb1.description: Some of my favorite things to shoot are shadows, textures, and 1x1 aspect ratios. I love when they all come together such as in this shot.

cc0a1dff-8972-5ce0-afbf-bbf130c772ea.title: Iceland Restaurant
cc0a1dff-8972-5ce0-afbf-bbf130c772ea.description: I love a good black and white film photo, especially with lots of contrast.

16c83704-14af-510c-b7d9-79d27109fb90.title: What a great place to go
16c83704-14af-510c-b7d9-79d27109fb90.description: Found this abandoned lot while walking home one evening. I could not help myself.

a5879800-06d3-53a5-b461-c9681700c03e.title: Sunset over La Sal Mountains
a5879800-06d3-53a5-b461-c9681700c03e.description: One of my absolute favorite locations is Southern Utah. As the sun was settings, I sent up my drone to take some photos. Just as the sun begins to disappear, the rocks started to take on colors of orange, purple, and blue.

61c5694a-26ad-51c5-96b7-924df06ac1e3.title: Mexico National Pyrotechnic Festival
61c5694a-26ad-51c5-96b7-924df06ac1e3.description: Each year thousands of people gather to watch several hundred floats, shaped like bulls and covered in fireworks parade through the streets. Eventually they reach a wide open field and are lit on fire.

79bf5bea-57f7-5e79-a84e-a5bf3f6bf502.title: The Drive through South Western Colorado
79bf5bea-57f7-5e79-a84e-a5bf3f6bf502.description: One of my favorite drives in the world runs from Durango through Silverton and Ouray. I first drove it in the springtime and knew I had to come back for the fall as the leaves were changing. The drive did not disappoint. The Aspen Trees were so incredibly vibrant.

b7334f77-f995-50a5-9629-1b9e6cb5e3c9.title: Sunset in Glacier National Park
b7334f77-f995-50a5-9629-1b9e6cb5e3c9.description: Moment captured just as the sun disappeared and the stars started to arrive.

a05b8eb0-6ca6-5ddc-a0e9-dc85a832b701.title: UFOs in Glacier National Park
a05b8eb0-6ca6-5ddc-a0e9-dc85a832b701.description: One evening, I was out shooting landscape photos in Glacier National Park. Every few minutes, a car would come around the corner and mess up whatever shot I was taking. I decided to lean into this and get creative. With the next car that came around the corner, I setup a long exposure and captured this.

a2d89c84-2572-5a6d-94ec-8c522f738ce3.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N

70fd8466-731a-59b4-8408-68afb3e55a14.title: Bridge
70fd8466-731a-59b4-8408-68afb3e55a14.description: Photography Tip: Some photos appear more striking in black and white. Consider using this technique in situations with prominent textures, patterns, geometry, or distracting colors.

8ebe04ab-bf2d-55be-ae72-cf1f3d281d11.title: Down into the Valley
8ebe04ab-bf2d-55be-ae72-cf1f3d281d11.description: I was going on a walk in Banff along a ridgeline and down in the valley, some trees against a river background offered this confusing perspective.

b40712e6-9832-54a0-b9ca-5bae9e6b7e59.title: Milky Way Over Baja
b40712e6-9832-54a0-b9ca-5bae9e6b7e59.description: Baja is a lovely place. For the most part there is no light pollution and the night sky shines so very brightly.

d757d9e6-0db7-52a2-a4e8-398b3629a902.title: g
d757d9e6-0db7-52a2-a4e8-398b3629a902.description: Photography Tip: When taking pictures, the shutter speed typically ranges from 1/60th to 1/500th of a second. Experiment with different speeds to achieve various effects. Shooting faster freezes motion, while shooting slower creates a sense of motion blur. You can also use an ND filter, which acts like sunglasses for your camera, allowing for even slower shutter speeds. This technique helped me achieve the smooth effect in this photo.

dc394a15-03fe-5e46-891f-a118071f5286.title: Moonrise over Baja
dc394a15-03fe-5e46-891f-a118071f5286.description: We were sitting on the beach watching the sunset. Eventually the moon started rising and it was quite orange and something I’ve not seen before. I ran to grab my tripod and set myself up for this long exposure. Within minutes the moon had returned to orange.

d3a6e217-4ad4-5c82-a5ad-ce9993f2b6af.title: Cotton Candy Sunset
d3a6e217-4ad4-5c82-a5ad-ce9993f2b6af.description: Every sunset over Southern Arizona offered something new. The greens, blues, purples, and pinks, pure cotton candy.

41112b23-ea8c-5ee9-893b-831413c4e3c2.title: Moove Along
41112b23-ea8c-5ee9-893b-831413c4e3c2.description: One of my favorite spots to camp near Phoenix is also used as open grazing for cattle. One morning, I awoke to scratches along the side of my van. I jumped out of pet, looked out the window, and found this beautiful creature passing along. I grabbed my camera and captured this one.

c286f0a1-d8b0-536d-8741-90bd33bb4588.title: Star Trails over the Superstitions
c286f0a1-d8b0-536d-8741-90bd33bb4588.description: Developer Tip - Instead of doing one long exposure, stack a bunch of photos together. The amount of light trails in the sky I didn't want to capture, such as planes and satellites, were much easier to remove by stacking photos instead of doing one long light trail.

462d359a-8c35-53e4-8ba4-a10ec3d3a7e4.title: Super Bloom
462d359a-8c35-53e4-8ba4-a10ec3d3a7e4.description: In mid March, the entirety of Arizona was covered with a sea of oranges, purples, and yellows. One afternoon, while driving, this was the view from the  road. I couldn't resist.

cdad5907-6d04-5b11-921f-60e551b4da74.title: Wandering Road
cdad5907-6d04-5b11-921f-60e551b4da74.description: I am an absolute sucker for S shaped paths - rivers, trails, roads, etc. Every opportunity that presents itself like this, I photograph.

6eef6b18-db28-5141-9b01-97a40860aef8.title: Abstract Clouds April 2024
6eef6b18-db28-5141-9b01-97a40860aef8.description: The clouds in Utah are something else. So too are the storms. When a storm rolls in with moody clouds, I have to get my camera out.

2f62b64f-6de1-5b34-82f2-3dec225244f3.title: Sky Above Utah
2f62b64f-6de1-5b34-82f2-3dec225244f3.description: As the sun was setting, this beautifully shaped cloud passed by for a brief moment.

085547d4-accb-597a-8565-1e9d31729908.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N
085547d4-accb-597a-8565-1e9d31729908.title: Mexico City Parade
085547d4-accb-597a-8565-1e9d31729908.description: Absolutely lovely parade during Day of the Dead. Interestingly inspired by a James Bond movie.

badf29a8-19a9-59be-a073-e93d0bde3ca2.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N
badf29a8-19a9-59be-a073-e93d0bde3ca2.title: Mexico City Day of the Dead Parade
badf29a8-19a9-59be-a073-e93d0bde3ca2.description: Absolutely lovely parade during Day of the Dead. Interestingly inspired by a James Bond movie.

85a8ecbc-936a-56ca-a39e-8189eba1b970.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N
85a8ecbc-936a-56ca-a39e-8189eba1b970.title: Mexico City Parade

5862dcbf-e659-551e-a731-2ed6900909fa.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N
5862dcbf-e659-551e-a731-2ed6900909fa.title: Day of the Dead Parade

091ebbbb-76ed-535b-8985-f8ced0577ee1.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N
091ebbbb-76ed-535b-8985-f8ced0577ee1.title: Day of the Dead Parade
091ebbbb-76ed-535b-8985-f8ced0577ee1.description: For the majority of the parade I was focused on the participants. For a moment, there was a lull in the parade and across the way I stopped to take notice of the crowd and captured this.

9b338dcb-e0e3-54c2-92e0-e4323ae6257f.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N

9399cc9b-2efa-5090-89e5-b5544b8c3e30.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N

ffcc700e-f65c-570c-9ba7-cce899662b61.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N

4d90222f-b799-508a-8591-91d583705946.lens: TAMRON SP 90mm F2.8 Di Macro VC USD F017N

c0a2bcf4-6615-5597-bfc7-ecf9ccb61dec.title: Storm in Eureka
c0a2bcf4-6615-5597-bfc7-ecf9ccb61dec.description:
One evening while sitting by my van, enjoying a campfire, a storm started to roll in. It was full of purples and dark blues and I figured I had to go out with my camera for a bit.

The best I've found to get photos like this is to set your camera up for a long exposure. Expose it a stop or two darker than what looks good - the lightening is going to brighten things up. If your camera has a built in interval feature - use it. Don't forget, stay safe out there!
